alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 27 at 3:06PM MST until December 29 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER TRAVEL IMPACTS EXPECTED TONIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING IN THE NORTHERN HIGH TERRAIN... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow as well as blowing and drifting snow expected. Total snow accumulations in the Tusas Mountains will range from 8 and 16 inches with locally in excess of two feet over mountain peaks. For the Jemez Mountains, 2 to 6 inches of snow is expected below 8,500 feet with 6 to 14 inches above 8,500 feet. For the Sangre de Cristo Mountains, 3 to 8 inches of snow is likely with amounts in excess of one foot at mountain pass level. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph will create near blizzard conditions and significant drifting of snow, especially in the Tusas Mountains. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, especially along U.S. Highway 64. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
